file_content.text: You took out Takor the Terrible. And I knew you first!
They're at peace now.
Well, blot the blasted suns from the sky! You took him out. The terror of Tatooine. I just--how?
No mere bandit can stand against the Force.
The Force was with me.
Well, remind me not to get you mad.
A brute like that will never stand against a well-executed assault.
Superior tactics.
If you say so. My grasp of tactics never went much past "charge."
I've just got a habit of turning up on the right end of the blaster, you know?
Sheer dumb luck.
That's the kind of habit you don't want to break.
We can do far more together than any of us alone.
Teamwork.
Without breaking a sweat.
Then I bow to you and whoever taught you besides.
And my boys? Are they at peace?
I hear Takor the Terrible's down a few boys of his own, now. There'll be some toasts to that tonight, I tell you.
And our lads? They get their taste of mercy?
Well? I don't get no news from the afterlife, you know. Did you do it? Are our boys at peace?
Hopefully we've spared them before they suffered too much.
They're dead now.
One day of torture like that is too long, still, it's better than a thousand years.
I gave my word. Don't doubt me now.
Don't question me.
Just wanted to hear it.
Who can tell?
Sure, from here, it's hard to see the difference between tortured and dead. But if it was you, you'd sure want someone to try.
I like to think they could hear that Gamorrean monster screaming right before they passed.
I like to think they're smiling somewhere now.
I wish we had you here for permanent. We'd get a few more enlisting if they knew someone like you had their backs.
Well, go if you want to, then. Would you want to be kept waiting inside something's stomach?
People are going soft here. Look around--not one of these idiots here has stepped forward to join the militia to defend our towns.
Can you believe it? Not a bleeding one.
Course, why would you fight, when all it buys you is an empty grave? When you know no one's coming back for the corpses?
Whose corpses? Did someone die?
Corpses?
Fifteen boys, killed by that sadistic Gamorrean warlord Takor the Terrible and not one man stands up to lead the rescue.
What are you saying?
Find some other old-timer if you're going to start moaning about "them young 'uns."
I don't have time for this.
An old-timer, huh? Let me tell you, I got more scars than wrinkles. And this is serious.
We lost a fifteen-man patrol yesterday to that sadistic Gamorrean warlord Takor the Terrible, and no one wants to lead the rescue.
By now, Takor's likely fed 'em to the Sarlacc--every Tatooinian's worst nightmare.
Gaping maw in the ground, surrounded by teeth and tentacles. Takor tosses in enemies, live, and the Sarlacc digests them for a thousand years. A long, painful death.
I would not wish such a horrific fate on anyone.
That's a horror story.
I'd like to see you stick that big glow rod right down the beast's throat.
I would not stand aside while men suffer needlessly.
Would you accept outside aid?
Then get on out there, Master Jedi. Because our boys need a friend like you.
"Leave no man behind." That's the cornerstone of any good military.
Your friends deserve better.
Right you are, sir. That's what I been trying to tell these clodheads.
I'm available, but I have a strong aversion to being fed to anything.
Are you asking for help?
Oh, yeah. You don't want to get in the Sarlacc, let me tell you.
What is this thing?
A thousand years?
No one really knows. It lives under the sands, center of Takor's territory. All anyone's ever seen is the mouth.
They say if it swallows you, it's got a way to keep you alive and suffering the whole time. You feel every scrap of flesh worn away.
You were stuck in there, you'd want someone to come along and grant you mercy, right?
If you're asking me to kill this warlord, just say so.
So you want Takor dead.
Might as well say you'll kill the desert itself! He's that big. Three meters at the shoulder and solid muscle.
And mean as a drunk rancor. The folks he doesn't give the Sarlacc come back with tongues cut out, no fingers.
Nah, all I want is help for my boys. A little mercy, you know.
So, you want me to rescue them?
Fine. I'll help.
Are you barking mad? No one comes out of a Sarlacc. I just want to end the misery, let them go easy into that dark night and all.
What's the going rate for mercy on this planet?
Depends on the price.
Do I look like a bank? You want to profit off this, take whatever riches the warlord's piled up out there.
You want to help our boys, drop these grenades in the Sarlacc's mouth. They'll poison anything left alive in there--a painless death.
And I wouldn't cry if you put some hurt on Takor's men along the way.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
You think I was asking for something? We don't need no outside help. We on Tatooine!
Kids these days....
